body:
This change in deps from "framework_lite" to "framework", and others like it in this PR, are problematic.

The issue is that we use gather_op_kernel_float_int32 (and other similar cc_libraries) in XLA ahead-of-time builds, via tfcompile.  We need to keep runtime dependencies at a minimum for these libraries, since some of our users on mobile (i.e. --config=android_arm) are relying on small generated codesize.

Furthermore I'm not sure whether the full "//tensorflow/core:framework" actually builds on --config=android_arm; I remember encountering problems here before.
body_html:
This change in deps from "framework_lite" to "framework", and others like it in this PR, are problematic.

The issue is that we use gather_op_kernel_float_int32 (and other similar cc_libraries) in XLA ahead-of-time builds, via tfcompile. We need to keep runtime dependencies at a minimum for these libraries, since some of our users on mobile (i.e. --config=android_arm) are relying on small generated codesize.

Furthermore I'm not sure whether the full "//tensorflow/core:framework" actually builds on --config=android_arm; I remember encountering problems here before.
body_text:
This change in deps from "framework_lite" to "framework", and others like it in this PR, are problematic.
The issue is that we use gather_op_kernel_float_int32 (and other similar cc_libraries) in XLA ahead-of-time builds, via tfcompile.  We need to keep runtime dependencies at a minimum for these libraries, since some of our users on mobile (i.e. --config=android_arm) are relying on small generated codesize.
Furthermore I'm not sure whether the full "//tensorflow/core:framework" actually builds on --config=android_arm; I remember encountering problems here before.
